subject: Re: [junit] Ant integration (was execution log file)
msgSnippet: (1) They don t want junit.jar in the CLASSPATH - if you do so, you must use  to define the task with a custom classpath *and* the task definition
messageBody:
(1) They don't want junit.jar in the CLASSPATH - if you do so, you
must use <taskdef> to define the task with a custom classpath *and*
the task definition itself (from optional.jar) must not live in
ANT_HOME/lib (specify it explicitly in the taskdef as well).

I didn't understand the part after the "*and*". Anyway - there's another option, which is to place the junit.jar (+ Xalan & Xerces, if you want to run the report task) in your Ant/lib. Ant.bat loads all jars in lib on Ant's classpath.

- Yishay
